data.title: The Chelsea Football Club Wiki
data.text:
From TheChels.info - The Chelsea Football Club Wiki

Jump to: navigation, search

2009-10 season 0Manager Carlo Ancelotti 0League Premier League 0Position 1st 0FA Cup Winners 0League Cup Quarter Finals 0Champions League 1st Knock Out Round 0Top scorer Didier Drogba (37)

The 2009-10 season was Chelsea's 95th of competitive football, and the club's 21st consecutive season in the top-flight. The season was the most successful in Chelsea's history to date, the Blues winning the Premier League and FA Cup to complete the club's first "Double" in manager Carlo Ancelotti's maiden season. The achievement comprised Chelsea's fourth league title, and sixth FA Cup triumph.

Awards

Chelsea Player of the Year: Didier Drogba

Chelsea Players' Player of the Year: Florent Malouda

FWA Tribute Award: Frank Lampard

PFA Team of the Year: Branislav Ivanovic, Didier Drogba

Premier League Golden Boot: Didier Drogba (29)

Premier League Manager of the Month: Carlo Ancelotti (November)

Premier League Player of the Month: Florent Malouda (March)

Chelsea Goal of the Season: Ashley Cole v Sunderland, 16 January 2010.

MOTD Goal of the Month: Didier Drogba vs Bolton Wanderers (October), Ashley Cole vs Sunderland (January), Frank Lampard vs Stoke City (April)

Special Recognition Award: Peter Bonetti for his 729 appearances and important place in the club's history.

Young Player of the Year: The entire Under-18 squad for winning the FA Youth Cup for the first time since 1961.

Chelsea Contribution: Thresa Conneely, press accreditation officer, for 33 years of service.
